SENT.plain: A young lady who had aplastic anaemia presented for cerebral venous thrombosis after five years of follow up
She was diagnosed to have paroxysmal nocturnal haemoglobinuria
She had received immunosuppressive therapy with methylprednisolone, cyclosporine-A, anti-lymphocyte globulin, danazol and pregnenolone
The relation between aplastic anaemia, paroxysmal nocturnal haemoglobinuria and cerebral venous thrombosis is discussed
The role of immunosuppressive therapy for aplastic anaemia in causation of paroxysmal nocturnal haemoglobinuria is reviewed
